title: Remote Transcription Feature [EPIC]
description:
Allow VoiceTypr instances to offload transcription to more powerful machines on the network. A high-end desktop with a GPU can serve as a transcription server for laptops and less powerful devices.

## Key Design Decisions
- Manual connections only (no auto-discovery in v1)
- Simple password authentication (optional)
- HTTP REST protocol
- Single model per server
- No automatic fallback
- No request rejection - queue instead

See: docs/plans/2026-01-14-remote-transcription-design.md

title: Bug: Network Sharing shows wrong model after changing selection
description:
When user changes the selected model in the Models tab, the Network Sharing 
section still shows the old model (e.g., "large-v3-turbo") instead of the 
newly selected model (e.g., "base.en").

## Steps to Reproduce
1. Enable Network Sharing (shows "large-v3-turbo")
2. Go to Models tab
3. Select a different model (e.g., "Base English")
4. Go back to Settings
5. Network Sharing still shows "large-v3-turbo"

## Expected Behavior
Network Sharing should show the currently selected model, and update when
the user changes their model selection.

## Root Cause
The NetworkSharingCard fetches model info on mount but doesn't:
1. Read the currently SELECTED model from settings
2. Listen for model selection changes

## Fix
- Read current_model from settings store
- Either re-fetch on tab focus, or listen for settings changes
- When sharing is active, restart sharing with new model if changed
close_reason: Fixed: NetworkSharingCard now uses useSettings to track current_model, shows mismatch warning with Update button when sharing model differs from selection

title: Add save recordings toggle for retry
description:
Add a settings toggle to save recorded audio files for retry/re-transcription.

## Motivation
Currently, if a remote transcription fails (e.g., server unreachable), the audio is lost. Users should be able to enable recording persistence to retry transcription later.

## Requirements
- New setting: 'Save recordings' toggle in Settings
- When enabled: Save WAV files to user data directory
- File naming: timestamp-based (e.g., 2024-01-14_15-30-00.wav)
- Show saved recordings in History section
- Allow re-transcribing saved recordings with different models

## Implementation
1. Add setting to AppSettings struct
2. Modify audio recording to optionally save to disk
3. Add 'Saved Recordings' section to History
4. Add 're-transcribe' action to saved recordings

title: Testing: Fix Windows DLL issue
description: TaskDialogIndirect entry point not found. Test binaries missing Common Controls v6 manifest.
close_reason: Fixed with run-tests.ps1 script that embeds Common Controls v6 manifest after build using mt.exe from Visual Studio

comments.author: Tom Chapin
comments.text:
Starting investigation. The issue: Tauri embeds a manifest with Common Controls v6 for the main binary, but test binaries don't get this. Attempted:
1. embed-manifest crate - conflicts with Tauri's manifest
2. .cargo/config.toml - breaks all deps
Next: Try mt.exe post-build to embed manifest

comments.author: Tom Chapin
comments.text:
Solution: Created run-tests.ps1 PowerShell script that:
1. Builds test binary with cargo test --no-run
2. Locates the test binary in target/debug/deps/
3. Embeds test.manifest (Common Controls v6) using mt.exe from Visual Studio
4. Runs the test binary

The root cause was that test binaries don't get Tauri's manifest embedding, which includes Common Controls v6 dependency required for TaskDialogIndirect (used by tauri-plugin-dialog).

Files created:
- src-tauri/run-tests.ps1 - PowerShell test runner
- src-tauri/test.manifest - Common Controls v6 manifest

All 53 remote transcription tests now pass on Windows.

title: Test: Remote transcription end-to-end verification
description:
Verify remote transcription feature works end-to-end before concurrency testing.

## Test Environment
Single machine (Windows PC with GPU)

## Prerequisites
- Build and run VoiceTypr from feature/remote-transcription branch
- Have at least one Whisper model downloaded (e.g., tiny.en)

## Test Steps

### 1. Server Setup
- Open Settings → Network Sharing
- Enable "Share on Network" toggle
- Note the displayed IP and port
- Optionally set a password

### 2. Client Setup (same machine, different instance or UI)
- Go to Models section
- Click "Add Server" button
- Enter localhost and the port from step 1
- Enter password if set
- Save connection

### 3. Verify Connection
- Server should show in Remote Servers section
- Status indicator should show "Online" (green)

### 4. Test Transcription
- Select the remote server as active model
- Record a short audio clip using hotkey
- Verify transcription completes successfully
- Check transcribed text appears in history

### 5. Verify Server Logs
- Check server shows incoming request in logs
- Verify transcription was processed on server side

## Success Criteria
- [ ] Server starts and shows IP/port
- [ ] Client can connect to server
- [ ] Online status indicator works
- [ ] Transcription request sent to server
- [ ] Transcription result returned to client
- [ ] Text appears in client's history

## Failure Scenarios to Check
- [ ] Wrong password shows authentication error
- [ ] Server offline shows offline indicator
- [ ] Network error shows appropriate message

title: Backend: Recording cleanup logic

Run after each successful recording save:

IMPLEMENTATION:

- Gets recordings directory path
- Lists all .wav files
- Sorts by metadata modified time
- Deletes oldest if over limit
- Logs deleted files

Call this function after successfully saving a new recording.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:
